Pipes¶

Parent pipe classes

class pipes.Regulator(functor, name='Regulator', upstreams=[], downstreams=[], ignore_exceptions=[], init_kwargs={}, stateful=False)¶

Regulator pipes are a special type of transformation that changes the data chuck throughput. Regulators can have both upstreams and downstreams. Typically used to batching or accumulating data.

Parameters

  • functor – Python coroutines

  • name – String associated with pipe segment

  • upstreams – List of Streams that are inputs to functor

  • downstreams – List of Streams that are outputs of functor

  • init_kwargs – Kwargs to initiate class object on process (no used when func_type = ‘function’)

  • ignore_exceptions – List of exceptions to ignore while pipeline is running

  • stateful – Set to True when using a class functor. Class functors must implement a ‘run’ method

class pipes.Sink(functor, name='Sink', upstreams=[], ignore_exceptions=[], init_kwargs={}, stateful=False)¶

Sink pipes are typically used to save data. Sinks have no downstreams, but will have one or more upstreams.

Parameters

  • functor – Python function or class

  • name – String associated with pipe segment

  • upstreams – List of Streams that are inputs to functor

  • init_kwargs – Kwargs to initiate class object on process (no used when func_type = ‘function’)

  • ignore_exceptions – List of exceptions to ignore while pipeline is running

  • stateful – Set to True when using a class functor. Class functors must implement a ‘run’ method

class pipes.Source(functor, name='Source', downstreams=[], ignore_exceptions=[], init_kwargs={}, stateful=False)¶

Source pipes are used to load and/or generate data. Sources have no upstreams, but will have one or more downstreams.

Parameters

  • functor – Python generator

  • name – String associated with pipe segment

  • downstreams – List of Streams that are outputs of functor

  • ignore_exceptions – List of exceptions to ignore while pipeline is running

  • init_kwargs – Kwargs to initiate class object on process (no used when func_type = ‘function’)

  • stateful – Set to True when using a class functor. Class functors must implement a ‘run’ method

class pipes.Transform(functor, name='Transform', upstreams=[], downstreams=[], ignore_exceptions=[], init_kwargs={}, stateful=False)¶

Transform pipes are used to perform arbitrary transformations on data. Transforms will have one or more upstreams and downstreams.

Parameters

  • functor – Python function or class

  • name – String associated with pipe segment

  • upstreams – List of Streams that are inputs to functor

  • downstreams – List of Streams that are outputs of functor

  • init_kwargs – Kwargs to initiate class object on process (no used when func_type = ‘function’)

  • ignore_exceptions – List of exceptions to ignore while pipeline is running

  • stateful – Set to True when using a class functor. Class functors must implement a ‘run’ method
